info.title: Grainvision API
info.description:
# Documentation
This is the documentation page for **Grainvision Web**. Created to provide a better understanding of how to use this app and build a better overall user experience. It contains all relevant paths and operations with important data, including their parameters, responses, and possible errors. 

The API can be divided into three main groups of endpoints:


### * **Facility Operations**

It consists of all the operations used to view, store, update and delete facilities, and all the pieces that compose them. It's the main characteristic of Grainvision Web and the one that is most deeply explained in this documentation page.

### * **Authentication Operations**

These are the operations which primary purpose is to authenticate the user to give them access into the application. Without authentication the user cannot operate with the API.

### * **Settings and Profile Operations**

This group is useful for configuration purposes, managing the user's profile and its information.

get.description: This request returns an object that contains information about the current user, including its username, email, roles, and permissions.

/api/settings/profile.description: Update username and email of a user.

patch.description: This operation receives values for username and email, and updates them from the current ones.

/api/facilities.description: Interaction of the user with facilities

schema.description: An array with all the stored facilities

get.description: This operation returns an array with all the stored facilities, each one being an object composed by their name, description and version.

/api/login.description: Log user into the app with username and password.

post.description: Providing a valid username and password, this operation authenticates the user, allowing him to access the application.

/api/facilities/{proyecto}.description: Get information about a specific facility.

get.description: This request returns an object with name, description, creation date, and version of a particular facility, specified in the path as a variable.

/api/facilities/{proyecto}/summary.description: Get the summary of a facility.

get.description: This operation shows an object that contains the exact number of sensors, and a written summary of a particular facility.

/api/facilities/{proyecto}/containers.description: Get an array with all the containers in a facility.

get.description: This request returns an array with all the containers included in a specific facility. Each container is an object that shows its tag and type.

This request returns a JSON object with information used to represent graphically a particular facility. This includes coordinates, sizes, angles, etc. of the different components that conform a facility.

post.description: This operation logs out the user, making them unauthenticated.

/api/facilities/{proyecto}/{tag}/cables.summary: Show all the cables in a container.
/api/facilities/{proyecto}/{tag}/cables.description: Display an array with all the cables contained inside a particular container.

get.summary: Show all cables inside a container.
get.description: This request displays an array with all the cables inside a particular container, with their information.
Show an object that displays the container's tag, and an array with all its truss.
This operation returns an array with the tags of all the sensors that are part of particular container.
Shows an object that contains the exact number of sensors, and a written summary of a particular container.

Representation.description: Object of the representation of a facility.

Login.title: Root Type for Login
Login.description: Object required to log into the application.

tag.name: tag
tag.description: Path of a specific container in a specific facility.

tags.name: Auth Operations
tags.description: All the operations that manage the authentication of a user.

tags.name: Facility Operations
tags.description: All the operations that are related to facilities for non-administrative roles.

tags.name: Settings and Profile Operations
tags.description: All the operations that provide and update information about a user.
